news_header: Honda and Nissan have ended merger talks but will continue their partnership on electric vehicles. The companies, along with Mitsubishi, aimed to combine to compete against rivals, especially in China.
news_original_title: Multi-billion dollar Honda-Nissan merger talks collapse
news_text: They will focus on a strategic partnership for the era of electric vehicles. This merger could have created a major automotive player alongside Toyota and others. Nissan, facing declining sales, had planned layoffs to address challenges. The electric vehicle market is increasingly competitive, particularly with Chinese manufacturers like BYD. Foxconn has shown interest in investing in Nissan.
